title: Export Filter Implementation in Popup
details:
FEATURE: Export Log Filtering (v1.6.0.9)

IMPLEMENTATION:
Added export filter functionality to popup.js to filter logs before exporting based on user's export filter settings.

KEY FUNCTIONS ADDED:

1. extractCategoryFromLogEntry(logEntry)
   - Parses log message: "[emoji DisplayName] [Action] Message"
   - Extracts display name, normalizes it
   - Maps to category ID using comprehensive mapping dictionary
   - Returns 'uncategorized' for unknown categories (fail-safe)

2. getExportFilterSettings()
   - Loads exportLogCategoriesEnabled from browser.storage.local
   - Falls back to all-enabled defaults if not set
   - Returns settings object: {category: boolean}

3. filterLogsByExportSettings(allLogs, exportSettings)
   - Filters log array based on enabled categories
   - Always includes 'uncategorized' logs (fail-safe)
   - Returns filtered array

INTEGRATION:
Modified exportAllLogs() function to:
1. Collect all logs (background + content)
2. Load export filter settings
3. Apply filter: filteredLogs = filterLogsByExportSettings(allLogs, settings)
4. Log statistics (total vs filtered count, percentage)
5. Export only filtered logs

CATEGORY MAPPING:
Comprehensive mapping for all log format variations:
- 'hover', 'hover events' → 'hover'
- 'url detection' → 'url-detection'
- 'clipboard', 'clipboard operations' → 'clipboard'
- 'keyboard', 'keyboard shortcuts' → 'keyboard'
- etc. (16 categories total)

NOTE: Since popup.js is not bundled, filter logic was inlined rather than imported from logger.js.
